answers.answer: My doctor also calls me if nothing is wrong. Just so I'm not anxious between appointments. It's nice that she does. :)
Yes they can tell by blood tests. How far along are you?

Yes urine and blood, but blood is most accurate.  I had it with 2 of mine and had to be induced, but everything turned out fine and they were perfect at 37 and 38 weeks.  Don't stress that will make your bp rise.  Try to rest and lay down as much as possible.

Yes they can tell by doing a blood test..she might also have you do a 24 hour urine test to test the protein in your urine...don't stress n try to relax as much as possible to avoid your blood pressure going up

question: How can they tell you have preeclampsia? ... At my last doc app. My doctor was concerned because of how swollen my legs/feets/ankles are and it seems to get worse ... They took 3 tubes of blood and I received a call from my doc yesterday but I couldnt answer and by the time I called she was out of the office.. I know she would only call if something was wrong soo im worried can they tell by my blood ?
title: preeclampsia?
